info.desc: Prevent text wrapping
Creates a push button with a heavy black border.
Left-aligns the text.
Right-aligns the text.
Wraps the text to multiple lines if the text is too long to fit on a single line in the control's available width.
Places text at the top of the control's available height.
Places the text at the bottom of the control's available height.
Specifies that the button is two-dimensional.
Vertically centers text in the control's available height.
Make this button the default selection
Makes a checkbox or radio button look and act like a push button.

Greyed out Check
Specifies that the combo box will be exactly the size specified by the application when it created the combo box. Usually, Windows CE sizes a combo box so that it does not display partial items.

Converts text typed in the combo box edit control from the Windows CE character set to the OEM character set and then back to the Windows CE set. This style is most useful for combo boxes that contain file names. It applies only to combo boxes created with the CBS_DROPDOWN style.

Shows a disabled vertical scroll bar in the list box when the box does not contain enough items to scroll. Without this style, the scroll bar is hidden when the list box does not contain enough items.

Automatically scrolls the text in an edit control to the right when the user types a character at the end of the line. If this style is not set, only text that fits within the rectangular boundary is enabled.
Converts to lowercase any uppercase characters that are typed into the edit control of a combo box.
(ComboBox only). Displays the list box at all times. The current selection in the list box is displayed in the edit control.
Sorts the items in the drop-list alphabetically.
Converts to uppercase any lowercase characters that are typed into the edit control of a ComboBox.

constants.desc: Set the range of dates eg(20050101-20120101)

info.desc: Displays the date in short format.
Provides an up-down control to the right of the control to modify date-time values.
Displays a checkbox inside the control that users can uncheck to make the control have no date/time selected
The calendar will drop down on the right side of the control instead of the left.
Format option 'LongDate'.
Format option 'Time'.
Format option blank/omitted.
Causes the drop-down calendar to drop down on the right side of the control instead of the left
Specifies that the combo box will be exactly the size specified by the application when it created the combo box. Usually, Windows CE sizes a combo box so that it does not display partial items.

Converts text typed in the combo box edit control from the Windows CE character set to the OEM character set and then back to the Windows CE set. This style is most useful for combo boxes that contain file names. It applies only to combo boxes created with the CBS_DROPDOWN style.

Shows a disabled vertical scroll bar in the list box when the box does not contain enough items to scroll. Without this style, the scroll bar is hidden when the list box does not contain enough items.

Automatically scrolls the text in an edit control to the right when the user types a character at the end of the line. If this style is not set, only text that fits within the rectangular boundary is enabled.
Converts to lowercase any uppercase characters that are typed into the edit control of a combo box.
(ComboBox only). Displays the list box at all times. The current selection in the list box is displayed in the edit control.
Sorts the items in the drop-list alphabetically.
Converts to uppercase any lowercase characters that are typed into the edit control of a ComboBox.

constants.desc: Set tab stops inside a multi-line edit control (numbers only)

info.desc: Centers text in a multiline edit control.
Right-aligns text in a multiline edit control.
Scrolls text up one page when the user presses the ENTER key on the last line.
Negates the default behavior for an edit control.
This style is most useful for edit controls that contain file names.
Remove border
Prevents the user's press of Control-A from selecting all text in the edit control
Prevents a multi-line edit control from capturing the Enter keystroke
Turns off word-wrapping in a multi-line edit control (re-load required to see effect)
Restricts the user's input to the visible width of the edit field
The characters typed by the user are automatically converted to lowercase
Makes it possible to have more than one line of text (Can not be combined with password)
Prevents the user from typing anything other than digits into the field
Hides the user's input (such as for password entry)
Prevents the user from changing the control's contents
The characters typed by the user are automatically converted to uppercase
Causes a tab keystroke to produce a tab character rather than navigating to the next control
Right-aligns the text.
Wraps the text to multiple lines if the text is too long to fit on a single line in the control's available width.
Places text at the top of the control's available height.
Places the text at the bottom of the control's available height.
Allows for a multi-line heading
Specifies that the list box will be exactly the size specified by the application when it created the list box.
Shows a disabled vertical scroll bar for the list box when the box does not contain enough items to scroll.
A simplified version of multi-select in which control-click and shift-click are not necessary because normal left clicks serve to extend the selection or de-select a selected item.

Enables a ListBox to recognize and expand tab characters when drawing its strings. The default tab positions are 32 dialog box units. A dialog box unit is equal to one-fourth of the current dialog box base-width unit.
Alternate Submit
Allows more than one item to be selected simultaneously via shift-click and control-click
Prevents items from being visibly highlighted when they are selected (but Gui Submit will still store the selected item)
Automatically sorts the contents of the list alphabetically
To omit the special top row that contains column titles
Prevents the user from selecting more than one row at a time
Allow editing of the text in the first column of each row
Prevents an F2 keystroke from editing the currently focused row
Notifies the script for more types of ListView events than normal
Provides a checkbox at the left side of each row
Provides horizontal and vertical lines to visually indicate the boundaries between rows and columns
Turns off the automatic sorting that occurs when the user clicks a column header
Prevents the header from being clickable
The control is kept alphabetically sorted in ascending
The control is kept alphabetically sorted in descending order

style.desc: Icons are automatically kept arranged in icon and small icon view.
This style specifies a virtual list-view control (not directly supported by AutoHotkey).
Scrolling is disabled. All items must be within the client area. This style is not compatible with the LVS_LIST or LVS_REPORT styles.
The image list will not be deleted when the control is destroyed. This style enables the use of the same image lists with multiple list-view controls.
The owner window can paint items in report view in response to WM_DRAWITEM messages (not directly supported by AutoHotkey).
The selection, if any, is always shown, even if the control does not have keyboard focus.
Item text is displayed on a single line in icon view. By default, item text may wrap in icon view.
Items are left-aligned in icon and small icon view.

constants.desc: Set the range of dates eg(20050101-20120101)

info.desc: Display week numbers (1-52) to the left of each row of days
Prevent the circling of today's date within the control
Prevent the display of today's date at the bottom of the control
Multi-select. Allows the user to shift-click or click-drag to select a range of adjacent dates

Centers the bitmap in the control. If the bitmap is too large, it will be clipped. For text controls If the control contains a single line of text, the text is centered vertically within the available height of the control
[Windows XP or later] Adjusts the bitmap to fit the size of the control.
Force picture to the background

constants.desc: Set the range to be something other than 0 to 100 (eg, -4-45)

info.desc: Displays a length of segments rather than a smooth continuous bar
[Requires Windows XP or later] This style is typically used to indicate an ongoing operation whose completion time is unknown.
Makes the bar rise or fall vertically rather than move along horizontally (Requires a variable to work properly)

info.desc: The control has a tick mark for each increment in its range of values. Use +/-TickInterval to have more flexibility.
+/-Thick. Allows the thumb's size to be changed.
The control does not display the moveable bar.
The thumb (the bar moved by the user) will be blunt on both ends rather than pointed at one end
Reverses the control so that the lower value is considered to be on the right/bottom rather than the left/top
The thumb (the bar moved by the user) will point to the top rather than the bottom
Omit tickmarks alongside the track
Creates a tooltip that reports the numeric position of the slider as the user is dragging it
Makes the control slide up and down rather than left and right
Override the window's custom background color and uses the system's default Tab control color
Prevent the tabs from taking up more than a single row
Unneeded tabs scroll to the opposite side of the control when a tab is selected.
Icons are aligned with the left edge of each fixed-width tab. This style can only be used with the TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style.
The tab control receives the input focus when clicked.
The parent window is responsible for drawing tabs.
Multiple tabs can be selected by holding down CTRL when clicking. This style must be used with the TCS_BUTTONS style.
Items under the pointer are automatically highlighted
All tabs are the same width. This style cannot be combined with the TCS_RIGHTJUSTIFY style.
The tab control has a tooltip control associated with it.
Rows of tabs will not be stretched to fill the entire width of the control. This style is the default.
The tab control does not receive the input focus when clicked.
Align tabs to the bottom
Creates a series of buttons at the top of the control rather than a series of tabs

Prevent text wrapping
Draws the top and bottom edges of the static control using the EDGE_ETCHED edge style.
Sends the parent window the STN_CLICKED notification when the user clicks the control.
Draws a half-sunken border around a static control.
Draws the left and right edges of the static control using the EDGE_ETCHED edge style.
Draws the frame of the static control using the EDGE_ETCHED edge style.
Specifies a rectangle filled with the current window frame color.
Specifies a rectangle filled with the current screen background color.
Specifies a rectangle filled with the current window background color. This color is white in the default color scheme.
Specifies a box with a frame drawn in the same color as the window frames.
Specifies a box with a frame drawn with the same color as the screen background (desktop).
Prevents interpretation of any ampersand (&) characters in the control's text as accelerator prefix characters.
Specifies a box with a frame drawn with the same color as the window background. This color is white in the default color scheme.
Centers the text in the control
Justifies text to the right of the control
Removes the + and - buttons
Removes the lines to link items
Prevents the tree-view control from sending TVN_BEGINDRAG notification messages.
Enables full-row selection in the tree view.This style cannot be used in conjunction with the TVS_HASLINES style.
Causes a selected item to remain selected when the tree-view control loses focus.
Enables hot tracking of the mouse in a tree-view control.
Disables both horizontal and vertical scrolling in the control. The control will not display any scroll bars.
Causes text to be displayed from right-to-left (RTL). Usually, windows display text left-to-right (LTR).

Causes the item being selected to expand and the item being unselected to collapse upon selection in the tree-view. If the user holds down the CTRL key while selecting an item, the item being unselected will not be collapsed.
Disables ToolTips.
Obtains ToolTip information by sending the TVN_GETINFOTIP notification.
Adds a checkbox to every item(reload required)
Disables the horizontal scroll bar
Prevents the user from editing treeview items
Cause a vertical UpDown to be isolated
Allows the user to press the Up or Down arrow keys on the keyboard to increase or decrease the UpDown control's position.
Include 0x80 in Options to omit the thousands separator that is normally present between every three decimal digits in the buddy control
Make's the control's buttons point left/right rather than up/down
Puts the UpDown on the left side of its buddy rather than the right
Causes the control to wrap around to the other end of its range when the user attempts to go beyond the minimum or maximum
